metadata.description: The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. The name can contain only letters, numbers and hyphens. The first and last characters must be a letter or number. Spaces are not allowed.
The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. The field can contain only lowercase letters and numbers. Name must be between 1 and 11 characters.
Location of the data factory. Currently, only East US, East US 2, and West Europe are supported.
Please specify if you want to write curated data into SQL database.

The name you provide will be appended with a unique sting to make it globally available. Your server name can contain only lowercase letters, numbers, and '-', but can't start or end with '-' or have more than 50 characters.
Value should not match special patterns. It should contain a length of maximum of 128.

Your login name must not contain a SQL Identifier or a typical system name (like admin, administrator, sa, root, dbmanager, loginmanager, etc.) or a built-in database user or role (like dbo, guest, public, etc.)

Your password must be at least 8 characters in length. Your password must contain characters from three of the following categories â€“ English uppercase letters, English lowercase letters, numbers (0-9), and non-alphanumeric characters (!, $, #, %, etc.) Your password cannot contain all or part of the login name. Part of a login name is defined as three or more consecutive alphanumeric characters.
Please specify comma separated email addresses on which you would like to receive the ADF pipeline alerts.

typeProperties.script:
parameters{
	filename as string ('chicago_curated_data'),
	runid as string ('runtime_guid')
}
source(output(
		{Data as of} as date 'MM/dd/yyyy',
		{Start Date} as date 'MM/dd/yyyy',
		{End Date} as date 'MM/dd/yyyy',
		State as string,
		Sex as string,
		{Age group} as string,
		{COVID-19 Deaths} as long,
		{Total Deaths} as long,
		{Pneumonia Deaths} as long,
		{Pneumonia and COVID-19 Deaths} as long,
		{Influenza Deaths} as long,
		{Pneumonia, Influenza, or COVID-19 Deaths} as long,
		Footnote as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	rowUrlColumn: 'lineage',
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true) ~> sourceCSV
FillEmptyFields select(mapColumn(
		Load_Date,
		Load_Time,
		Data_As_Of,
		Start_Date,
		End_Date,
		State,
		Sex,
		Age_Group,
		Covid_19_Deaths,
		Total_Deaths,
		Pneumonia_Deaths,
		Pneumonia_And_Covid_19_Deaths,
		Influenza_Deaths,
		Pneumonia_Influenza_Or_Covid_19_Deaths
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> DropUnwantedColumns
sourceCSV derive(Load_time = currentTimestamp(),
		Load_date = currentDate()) ~> AddNewColumns
AddNewColumns select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,'-','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveDashes
RemoveDashes select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,' ','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveSpaces
RemoveSpaces select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,',','') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveCommas
RemoveCommas select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace(initCap(regexReplace($$,'_',' ')),' ','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> CapatalizeInitials
CapatalizeInitials derive(Influenza_Deaths = iifNull(Influenza_Deaths, toLong(0), Influenza_Deaths),
		Covid_19_Deaths = iifNull(Covid_19_Deaths, toLong(0), Covid_19_Deaths),
		Total_Deaths = iifNull(Total_Deaths, toLong(0), Total_Deaths),
		Pneumonia_Deaths = iifNull(Pneumonia_Deaths, toLong(0), Pneumonia_Deaths),
		Pneumonia_Influenza_Or_Covid_19_Deaths = iifNull(Pneumonia_Influenza_Or_Covid_19_Deaths, toLong(0), Pneumonia_Influenza_Or_Covid_19_Deaths),
		Pneumonia_And_Covid_19_Deaths = iifNull(Pneumonia_And_Covid_19_Deaths, toLong(0), Pneumonia_And_Covid_19_Deaths)) ~> FillEmptyFields
DropUnwantedColumns sink(input(
		{Data as of} as string,
		{Start Date} as string,
		{End Date} as string,
		State as string,
		Sex as string,
		{Age group} as string,
		{COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		{Total Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia and COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		{Influenza Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia, Influenza, or COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		Footnote as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkLatestCSV
DropUnwantedColumns sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.jsonl'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestJsonl
DropUnwantedColumns sink(input(
		{Data as of} as string,
		{Start Date} as string,
		{End Date} as string,
		State as string,
		Sex as string,
		{Age group} as string,
		{COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		{Total Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia and COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		{Influenza Deaths} as string,
		{Pneumonia, Influenza, or COVID-19 Deaths} as string,
		Footnote as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkCSV
DropUnwantedColumns sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.jsonl'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkJsonl
DropUnwantedColumns sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestParquet
DropUnwantedColumns sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkParquet

parameters{
	filename as string ('demographics_curated_data'),
	runid as string ('runtime_guid')
}
source(output(
		{ZIP Code} as long,
		{Week Number} as long,
		{Week Start} as date,
		{Week End} as date,
		{Cases - Weekly} as long,
		{Cases - Cumulative} as double,
		{Case Rate - Weekly} as double,
		{Case Rate - Cumulative} as double,
		{Tests - Weekly} as long,
		{Tests - Cumulative} as double,
		{Test Rate - Weekly} as double,
		{Test Rate - Cumulative} as double,
		{Percent Tested Positive - Weekly} as double,
		{Percent Tested Positive - Cumulative} as double,
		{Deaths - Weekly} as long,
		{Deaths - Cumulative} as double,
		{Death Rate - Weekly} as double,
		{Death Rate - Cumulative} as double,
		Population as long,
		{Row ID} as string,
		{ZIP Code Location} as string
	),
	allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	ignoreNoFilesFound: false,
	rowUrlColumn: 'lineage',
	inferDriftedColumnTypes: true,
	dateFormats: ['MM/dd/yyyy'],
	timestampFormats: ['MM/dd/yyyy HH:mm:ss'],
	preferredIntegralType: 'long',
	preferredFractionalType: 'double') ~> sourceCSV
DeriveLocationColumns select(mapColumn(
		Zip_Code,
		Week_Number,
		Week_Start,
		Week_End,
		Cases_Weekly,
		Cases_Cumulative,
		Case_Rate_Weekly,
		Case_Rate_Cumulative,
		Tests_Weekly,
		Tests_Cumulative,
		Test_Rate_Weekly,
		Test_Rate_Cumulative,
		Percent_Tested_Positive_Weekly,
		Percent_Tested_Positive_Cumulative,
		Deaths_Weekly,
		Deaths_Cumulative,
		Death_Rate_Weekly,
		Death_Rate_Cumulative,
		Population,
		Row_Id,
		Zip_Code_Location,
		Lineage,
		Load_Time,
		Load_Date,
		Longitude,
		Latitude
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> DropLineageColumn
sourceCSV derive(Load_time = currentTimestamp(),
		Load_date = currentDate()) ~> AddNewColumns
AddNewColumns select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,'-','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveDashes
RemoveDashes select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,' ','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveSpaces
RemoveSpaces select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace($$,'___','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> RemoveCommas
RemoveCommas select(mapColumn(
		each(patternMatch(`.*`),
			regexReplace(initCap(regexReplace($$,'_',' ')),' ','_') = $$)
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> CapatalizeInitials
CapatalizeInitials derive(Cases_Weekly = iifNull(Cases_Weekly, toLong(0), Cases_Weekly),
		Cases_Cumulative = iifNull(Cases_Cumulative, toLong(0), Cases_Cumulative),
		Case_Rate_Weekly = iifNull(Case_Rate_Weekly, toLong(0), Case_Rate_Weekly),
		Case_Rate_Cumulative = iifNull(Case_Rate_Cumulative, toLong(0), Case_Rate_Cumulative),
		Tests_Weekly = iifNull(Tests_Weekly, toLong(0), Tests_Weekly),
		Tests_Cumulative = iifNull(Tests_Cumulative, toLong(0), Tests_Cumulative),
		Test_Rate_Weekly = iifNull(Test_Rate_Weekly, toLong(0), Test_Rate_Weekly),
		Test_Rate_Cumulative = iifNull(Test_Rate_Cumulative, toLong(0), Test_Rate_Cumulative),
		Percent_Tested_Positive_Weekly = iifNull(Percent_Tested_Positive_Weekly, toLong(0), Percent_Tested_Positive_Weekly),
		Percent_Tested_Positive_Cumulative = iifNull(Percent_Tested_Positive_Cumulative, toLong(0), Percent_Tested_Positive_Cumulative),
		Deaths_Weekly = iifNull(Deaths_Weekly, toLong(0), Deaths_Weekly),
		Deaths_Cumulative = iifNull(Deaths_Cumulative, toLong(0), Deaths_Cumulative),
		Death_Rate_Weekly = iifNull(Death_Rate_Weekly, toLong(0), Death_Rate_Weekly),
		Death_Rate_Cumulative = iifNull(Death_Rate_Cumulative, toLong(0), Death_Rate_Cumulative),
		Population = iifNull(Population, toLong(0), Population)) ~> FillEmptyFields
FillEmptyFields derive(Longitude = toDouble(trim(split({Zip_Code_Location}, ' ')[2],'(')),
		Latitude = toDouble(trim(split({Zip_Code_Location}, ' ')[3],')'))) ~> DeriveLocationColumns
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkLatestCSV
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.jsonl'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestJsonl
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.csv'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> SinkCSV
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.jsonl'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkJsonl
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename, '.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkLatestParquet
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	format: 'parquet',
	partitionFileNames:[(concat($filename,'_', $runid,'.parquet'))],
	partitionBy('hash', 1),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true) ~> sinkParquet
DropLineageColumn sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: false,
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	recreate:true,
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError') ~> sinkSQL

ifTrueActivities.name: Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns
Alert Current Schema Has More Columns
Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement
Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns
Alert Current Schema Has More Columns
Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement

sqlReaderQuery.value:
IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = 'chicago')
BEGIN
EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA chicago')
END
IF NOT EXISTS (
    select * 
    from sys.objects 
    WHERE object_id = OBJECT_ID(N'[chicago].[DataTypeChangedProc]')
    )
BEGIN
    EXEC('CREATE PROCEDURE chicago.DataTypeChangedProc AS IF OBJECT_ID(''chicago.storeProcTable'', ''u'') IS NOT NULL DROP TABLE chicago.storeProcTable; CREATE TABLE chicago.storeProcTable( table1_name varchar(255), Column1_name varchar(255), DATA_TYPE1 varchar(255), table2_name varchar(255), Column2_name varchar(255), DATA_TYPE2 varchar(255) ); INSERT INTO chicago.storeProcTable SELECT c1.table_name, c1.COLUMN_NAME, c1.DATA_TYPE, c2.table_name, c2.COLUMN_NAME, c2.DATA_TYPE FROM [INFORMATION_SCHEMA].[COLUMNS] c1 INNER JOIN [INFORMATION_SCHEMA].[COLUMNS] c2 ON (c1.COLUMN_NAME = c2.COLUMN_NAME AND c1.data_type <> c2.DATA_TYPE) WHERE c1.table_name=''curatedTable'' AND c2.table_name = ''previousTable'';')
    select Count(*) from sys.symmetric_keys;
END

ELSE

BEGIN
    select Count(*) from sys.symmetric_keys;
END

IF NOT EXISTS (SELECT * FROM sys.schemas WHERE name = 'chicago')
BEGIN
EXEC('CREATE SCHEMA chicago')
select Count(*) from sys.symmetric_keys;
END
ELSE
BEGIN
    select Count(*) from sys.symmetric_keys;
END

sink.preCopyScript:
IF OBJECT_ID('[chicago].[previousTableSaveCopy]', 'U') IS NOT NULL

BEGIN

DROP TABLE [chicago].[previousTableSaveCopy];

END

IF OBJECT_ID('[chicago].[previousTable]', 'U') IS NOT NULL

BEGIN

DROP TABLE [chicago].[previousTable]; 

END

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has less column(s) than the schema of the same source previously detected.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Current Schema Has Less Columns

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has more column(s) than the schema of the same source previously detected.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Current Schema Has More Columns

properties.description: It is to notify that the current schema of the source has same number of columns as the schema of the same source previously detected but either the arrangement of the columns is different or one or more columns have different names.

dimensions.name: Name
values: Alert Equal Number But Different Names Or Arrangement

properties.description: Change in data type for one or more column(s) has been detected in the sql table
